snippet: Gen. James N. Mattis, the head of the military’s Central Command, will discuss the airstrike that killed 24 Pakistani soldiers and wrecked relations.
abstract: Gen James N Mattis, the head of the military’s Central Command, will meet Gen Ashfaq Parvez Kayani, the Pakistani Army chief of staff, to discuss the investigations of an exchange of fire at the Afghan border that killed 24 Pakistani soldiers, as well as new border coordination procedures to prevent a recurrence; it is the first visit by a high-ranking American official since the cross-border confrontation in November 2011.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Declan Walsh from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Gen. James N. Mattis, the head of the military’s Central Command, will discuss the airstrike that killed 24 Pakistani soldiers and wrecked relations.

headline.seo: U.S. Sending General to Repair Ties With Pakistan
headline.main: U.S. Sending Commander to Repair Ties With Pakistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sending Senior Commander to Repair Ties With Pakistan
